overview_of_class: This course explores the last 250 years of European history (1750 to the present) in order to find an answer to the question "What is modern Europe?" It will not cover everything. It is designed to be an analysis of the ideas, people and events that transformed Europe from small territorial states to industrial empires that spread around the world and then collapsed. Our goal is to comprehend how Europeans understood these changes and transformed them into a definition of modernity that lives on today. Ultimately, this course argues that understanding the history of Modern Europe is essential for understanding how the modern world is defined.
name: Topics in History
title: DOHA HISTORY 242-0-70 Topics in History
enrl_requirement:
Enrollment Requirements: NUQ: Seats are reserved for Sophomore and Freshmen only.

Class reserved for NU Qatar JOUR students.
